Instrument.name: The Optical Probe Experiment (OPE) for Giotto
Instrument.description: The Optical Probe Experiment (OPE) on the Giotto Spacecraft recorded the polarized emissivity of the dust and gas in cometary comae. It consisted of a photometer-polarimeter viewing along the spin axis of the spacecraft in the anti-ram direction (i.e., the direction from which the spacecraft had come). It measured the integral brightness along the track as a function of position along the track. The derivative of this signal was the polarized emissivity at each point of the track. The instrument employed seven interference filters arranged in a mosai to isolate the various spectral regions, with the light passing through linearly polarized foil as it traveled through the objective. Polarization was measured by the rotation of the spacecraft, which in turn rotated the linearly polarized foil.
